description: Gets information about a block list used for query suggestions for an index. This is used to check the current settings that are applied to a block list. DescribeQuerySuggestionsBlockList is currently not supported in the Amazon Web Services GovCloud (US-West) region.

parameters.name: IndexId
parameters.description: The identifier of the index for the block list.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The identifier of the block list you want to get information on.

nested_items.name: IndexId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the index for the block list.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The identifier of the block list.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the block list.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description for the block list.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status of the block list. When the value is ACTIVE, the block list is ready for use.

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: The error message containing details if there are issues processing the block list.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp when a block list for query suggestions was created.

nested_items.name: UpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp when a block list for query suggestions was last updated.

nested_items.name: SourceS3Path
nested_items.description: Shows the current S3 path to your block list text file in your S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: Bucket
nested_items.description: The name of the S3 bucket that contains the file.

nested_items.name: ItemCount
nested_items.description: The current number of valid, non-empty words or phrases in the block list text file.

nested_items.name: FileSizeBytes
nested_items.description: The current size of the block list text file in S3.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The IAM (Identity and Access Management) role used by Amazon Kendra to access the block list text file in S3.
